history.content:
Hi There,

I'm sorry that getting into these classes have been so difficult. We're making an adjustment to the policy so that EECS juniors and seniors can take 16B in spring; however I would still recommend using Phase I units.

One thing I forgot to mention is that although we've set aside seats for EECS juniors and seniors, the system is not working properly right now so if you enroll right now, you might be waitlisted. The SIS team is working on this and I hope it's fixed soon.

Hi There,

I'm sorry that getting into these classes have been so difficult. We're making an adjustment to the policy so that EECS juniors and seniors can take 16B in spring; however I would still recommend using Phase I units.

children.subject: I checked the waitlist this morning and it appears that things are working again. Those who were on the waitlist and had seats reserved were enrolled automatically.
I ended up on position 3 of the waitlist, but after manually dropping and re-adding, it seems to have worked!
Phase I-ed it, so I should just sit tight until the adjustment period? Will adjustments be made automatically, or do I need to drop and re-enroll at some point?
I am on the wait list and I am also an EECS junior, should I just sit tight and just wait for stuff to happen?

history.content:
Due to the way priorities for ee16b is set up here https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/eecs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy, EECS juniors will have to add themselves to the waitlist and only be allowed in during the adjustment period. EE enrollment has been a constant pain point as my 1st year 20/40 were being phased out and 16a wasn't available, my 2nd year the small amount of seats in 16a had priority for freshman, and now my 3rd year 16b enrollment prioritizes even non-EECS CoE and declared CS majors who don't even need the class over me.

Is there anything being planned for the 3rd/4th year EECS students who need these classes to graduate?
history.subject: EE16b as a EECS Junior
